description: This file provides environment configuration helpers for a React application. It includes functions to retrieve and parse environment variables, such as API base URLs, feature flags, experiment toggles, telemetry settings, and log levels. The functions facilitate normalized access to environment variables and include logic for fallback and development warnings.

methods.name: str(v)
methods.description: Safely trims and returns a string environment variable or undefined if invalid.

methods.name: parseBool(v, defaultValue = false)
methods.description: Parses a string environment variable into a boolean, accepting common truthy and falsy values.

methods.name: parseFeatureFlags(flags)
methods.description: Parses a comma-separated string into a feature flags object, supporting key=value pairs.

methods.name: getEnv()
methods.description: Retrieves the environment variables from process.env, with fallback to empty object.

methods.name: getBaseUrl()
methods.description: Resolves the API base URL from environment variables or falls back to window.location.origin with a warning in development.

methods.name: getFeatureFlags()
methods.description: Returns an object representing feature flags parsed from environment variable.

methods.name: isExperimentsEnabled()
methods.description: Returns a boolean indicating if experiments are enabled based on environment variable.

methods.name: isTelemetryDisabled()
methods.description: Returns a boolean indicating if telemetry is disabled based on environment variable.

methods.name: getLogLevel()
methods.description: Provides a normalized log level string based on environment variable, defaulting to 'info'.

methods.name: getEnvSummary()
methods.description: Returns a summary object of environment configurations for diagnostics.
